summary: This document details a quitclaim deed executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein, transferring property interests from L.S.J., LLC to Nautilus, Inc. in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It includes notarized affirmations of Epstein's identity and ownership, as well as a tax clearance letter confirming no outstanding obligations on the property.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is identified as the sole member of L.S.J., LLC and the President of Nautilus, Inc., executing the quitclaim deed for the property transfer.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellarhals
persons.context: Erika A. Kellarhals is mentioned as a notary public who witnessed the execution of the deed by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

persons.name: Valencia Jackson
persons.context: Valencia Jackson is mentioned as the Tax Collector who certified that there are no outstanding real property tax obligations for the property.

persons.name: Courtney Reese
persons.context: Courtney Reese is identified as the Recorder of Deeds for St. Thomas/St. John, overseeing the official records related to the property transaction.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the sole member of L.S.J., LLC, which is involved in the property transaction.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is the President and sole beneficial owner of Nautilus, Inc., which is the grantee in the property transfer.
Erika A. Kellarhals acted as a notary public witnessing the execution of the deed by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Valencia Jackson, as Tax Collector, certified that L.S.J., LLC has no outstanding real property tax obligations.

events.title: Property Transfer via Quitclaim Deed
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed a quitclaim deed transferring property from L.S.J., LLC to Nautilus, Inc.

events.title: Tax Clearance Certification
events.description: Valencia Jackson certified that there are no outstanding real property tax obligations for the property owned by L.S.J., LLC.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, Suite 113, St. Thomas, VI 00802
9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Ste 15-16, St. Thomas, VI 00802
Little St. James Island, 6B Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed a quitclaim deed on December 25, 2011, transferring property from L.S.J., LLC to Nautilus, Inc.
The property consists of approximately 36.7 acres, 23 acres, and 11.8 acres on Little St. James Island.
Erika A. Kellarhals served as the notary public for the deed execution.
Valencia Jackson confirmed that L.S.J., LLC had no outstanding real property tax obligations as of December 27, 2011.
Courtney Reese is the Recorder of Deeds overseeing the official records for the property transaction.
